variables.systemDescription: The ZX Spectrum is an 8-bit personal home computer released in the United Kingdom in 1982 by Sinclair Research. Famous for its rubber keys and distinctive color clash, it became the most popular home computer in the UK, fostering a generation of bedroom programmers and iconic games like Jet Set Willy and Manic Miner.
